item.title: Mozilla fixes Firefox zero-days exploited at hacking contest
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Mozilla released emergency security updates to address two Firefox zero-day vulnerabilities demonstrated in the recent Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking competition. [...]

item.title: Hackers earn $1,078,750 for 28 zero-days at Pwn2Own Berlin
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking competition has concluded, with security researchers earning $1,078,750 after exploiting 29 zero-day vulnerabilities and encountering some bug collisions. [...]

item.title: New 'Defendnot' tool tricks Windows into disabling Microsoft Defender
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new tool called 'Defendnot' can disable Microsoft Defender on Windows devices by registering a fake antivirus product, even when no real AV is installed. [...]

item.title: Microsoft confirms May Windows 10 updates trigger BitLocker recovery
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has confirmed that some Windows 10 and Windows 10 Enterprise LTSC 2021 systems will boot into BitLocker recovery after installing the May 2025 security updates. [...]

item.title: Israel arrests new suspect behind Nomad Bridge $190M crypto hack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An American-Israeli national namedAlexander Gurevich has been arrested in Israel for his alleged involvement in exploiting the Nomad bridge smart-contract in August 2022 that allowed hackers to siphon $190 million. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT rolls out Codex, an AI tool for software programming
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is rolling out 'Codex' for ChatGPT, which is an AI agent that automates and delegates programming tasks for software engineers. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit VMware ESXi, Microsoft SharePoint zero-days at Pwn2Own
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: During the second day of Pwn2Own Berlin 2025, competitors earned $435,000 after exploiting zero-day bugs in multiple products, including Microsoft SharePoint, VMware ESXi, Oracle VirtualBox, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, and Mozilla Firefox. [...]

item.title: Printer maker Procolored offered malware-laced drivers for months
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: For at least half a year, the official software supplied with Procolored printers included malware in the form of a remote access trojan and a cryptocurrency stealer. [...]

item.title: Ransomware gangs increasingly use Skitnet post-exploitation malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ransomware gang members increasingly use a new malware called Skitnet ("Bossnet") to perform stealthy post-exploitation activities on breached networks. [...]

item.title: US charges 12 more suspects linked to $230 million crypto theft
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Twelve more suspects were charged in a RICO conspiracy for their alleged involvement in the theft of over $230 million in cryptocurrency and laundering the funds using crypto exchanges and mixing services. [...]

item.title: CISA tags recently patched Chrome bug as actively exploited
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: On Thursday, CISA warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their systems against ongoing attacks exploiting a high-severity vulnerability in the Chrome web browser. [...]
